sen.e: In the late Sengoku Period, powerful Sengoku daimyo brought their vassals into complete subordination, whereas before they had been independent to a certain degree and were able to refuse orders depending on the circumstances.
sen.cmt: changed "Warring States period" to "Sengoku Period" to match the word list; rearranged sentence and fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: In the late Sengoku period, powerful Sengoku daimyo brought their vassals into complete subordination, whereas before they had been independent to a certain degree and were able to refuse orders depending on the circumstances.
sen.cmt: Periodの頭文字を小文字に変更

sen.j: そして、城下町を形成して屋敷を与え、家臣または家臣とその妻子を住まわせることで背信を防いだり、次第に武士の土着化を防ぐようになっていった。
sen.e: Further, they constructed castle towns, gave residences and got vassals and their family to reside there so that they could prevent vassals' revolt and indigenization.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Sengoku daimyo constructed castle towns, giving residences to their vassals and families inside the towns in order to prevent revolts and indigenization.
sen.cmt: I'm not sure "indigenization" is a word, but since it works so well here, I can understand it and can't find a better word to use, I left it alone; fixed grammar
sen.e: Sengoku daimyo constructed castle towns, giving residences to their vassals and families inside the towns in order to prevent revolts and indigenization.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 豊臣秀吉が関白となって以降は兵農分離が進んだ。
sen.e: After Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI became kanpaku (A chief adviser to the Emperor), heinobunri (separation of warrior class from the soil of its territory) policy was implemented and as a result, vassals who had been engaged in agriculture in their territories in times of peace became full-time bureaucrats or warriors.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI became a Kanpaku (chief adviser to the Emperor), a policy called heinobunri (separation of warrior class from the soil of its territory) was implemented. As a result of the policy, vassals who had been engaged in agriculture in their territories in times of peace became full-time bureaucrats or warriors.
sen.cmt: capitalized "Kanpaku"; split into two sentences for easier reading and fixed grammar accordingly
sen.e: After Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI became a Kanpaku (chief adviser to the Emperor), a policy called heinobunri (separation of warrior class from the soil of its territory) was implemented.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: その結果、平時は知行地で農業にも携わった家臣を完全なる文吏または武人として専業化させるに至った。
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: As a result of the policy, vassals who had been engaged in agriculture in their territories in times of peace became full-time bureaucrats or warriors.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: 大名と家臣の関係も必要に応じ登城し務めを果たす関係から常に登城し務めを果たす専従の関係へと発展していった。
sen.e: As a result, the relation between daimyo and vassals developed into the one under which vassals, who had come to castle and worked only when necessary, were required to come to castle and work everyday.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: This caused a change in the relationship between vassals and daimyo. Whereas vassals formerly went to the castle to work when necessary, under the new policy they were required to work in the castle every day.
sen.cmt: split into two sentences and fixed grammar to read more smoothly
sen.e: This caused a change in the relationship between vassals and daimyo; whereas vassals formerly went to the castle to work when necessary, under the new policy they were required to work in the castle every day.
sen.cmt: ピリオドで二文に分かれていますが、セミコロンでつなぎました。

sen.j: 江戸時代以降となると、将軍の絶対的な権力の下で直臣たる近世大名と陪臣である家臣団の関係はより絶対的な主従関係となった。
sen.e: In the Edo period when shogun held absolute authority, the relation between kinsei (early modern) daimyo, who were jikishin (great vassal), and their Kashindan, who were baishin (indirect vassal), became much more absolute.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: During the Edo period when the Shogun held absolute authority, relations between Kinsei daimyo (early modern lords), who were Jikishin (great vassals), and their Kashindan, who were Baishin (indirect vassals), became a categorical master-subordinate relationship.
sen.cmt: capitalized "Shogun"; fixed grammar to read more naturally; used "master-subordinate relationship for "主従関係"
sen.e: During the Edo period when the Shogun held absolute authority, relations between Kinsei daimyo (early modern lords), who were Jikishin (great vassals), and their Kashindan, who were Baishin (indirect vassals), became a categorical master-subordinate relationship.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 家臣に領地を与え、または本領安堵をし土地支配権を認める知行制に替えて、武士の給与を俸禄制とし、大名の土地支配権を大名が一括して担う傾向が強くなった。
sen.e: Daimyo adopted horoku (salary) system in place of chigyo system (the system under which vassals were give the land or entitled to the right to rule the land) and monopolized the right to rule the land.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Daimyo adopted a horoku (salary) system in place of the chigyo system (a system under which vassals were entitled and given the right to rule the land) and monopolized the right to rule the land.
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: Daimyo adopted a horoku (salary) system in place of the chigyo system (a system under which vassals were entitled and given the right to rule the land) and monopolized the right to rule the land.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: その中で次第に家臣団が支配下の領主群から、大名家の奉公集団への性格を強めることになっていった。
sen.e: Under such circumstances, the nature of Kashindan changed from a group of ryoshu to a group of employees serving for daimyo family.
Under these circumstances, the nature of Kashindan changed from a group of ryoshu (feudal lords) to a group of employees serving a daimyo family.
sen.cmt: changed "such" to "these"; added explanation for "ryoshu"; fixed grammar
sen.e: Under these circumstances, the nature of Kashindan changed from a group of ryoshu (feudal lords) to a group of employees serving a daimyo family.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 平穏な時代の訪れとともに武断的な家臣よりは文治的な家臣が重用されるようになったことに加え、安土桃山時代になされた兵農分離に加え江戸時代に俸禄制が主流になったことで武士の吏僚化が益々進んだ。
sen.e: With the arrival of peaceful time, samurai increasingly became buraucratic not only because of the fact that vassals excelled in governance were given important positions instead of those excelled in military affairs but also because of heinobunri policy implemented in the Azuchi-Momoyama period and the adoption of horoku system in the Edo period
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: As it became a peaceful period, samurai became increasingly bureaucratic, not only due to vassals being given important positions when they excelled in governance instead of in military affairs, but because of the heinobunri policy implemented in the Azuchi-Momoyama period and the adoption of the horoku system in the Edo period as well.
sen.cmt: buraucratic→bureaucratic; changed "With the arrival of peaceful time" to "As it became a peaceful period"; fixed grammar
sen.e: As it became a peaceful period, samurai became increasingly bureaucratic, not only due to vassals being given important positions when they excelled in governance instead of in military affairs, but because of the heinobunri policy implemented in the Azuchi-Momoyama period and the adoption of the horoku system in the Edo period as well.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: その結果、領主としての武士は官僚・役人としての武士としての性格を強めることとなった。
sen.e: As a result, the nature of samurai changed from ryoshu to bureaucrats/officials.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: This resulted in the nature of samurai changing from ryoshu to bureaucrats and officials.
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: This resulted in the nature of samurai changing from ryoshu to bureaucrats and officials.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
